name: PowerPlatformSetConnectionVariables
description: Sets BuildTools.* variables to provide custom script tasks access to use the Service Connection as a single source of truth.
author: Microsoft

outputVariables.name: BuildTools.ApplicationId
outputVariables.description: Output variable of Application Id used by Service Connection

outputVariables.name: BuildTools.ClientSecret
outputVariables.description: Output variable of Client Secret used by Service Connection

outputVariables.name: BuildTools.TenantId
outputVariables.description: Output variable of Tenant Id used by Service Connection

outputVariables.name: BuildTools.DataverseConnectionString
outputVariables.description: Output variable of a Dataverse connection string based on values used by Service Connection

outputVariables.name: BuildTools.UserName
outputVariables.description: Output variable of Username used by Service Connection

outputVariables.name: BuildTools.Password
outputVariables.description: Output variable of Password used by Service Connection

inputs.name: authenticationType
inputs.label: Authentication type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Authentication via username/password is simpler to set up but won't work if your AAD tenant requires MFA; use Service Principal Name (SPN) if MFA is required.

inputs.name: PowerPlatformEnvironment
inputs.label: Service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Authenticate with your Power Platform environment with username/password. Does not support MFA.

inputs.name: PowerPlatformSPN
inputs.label: Service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Authenticate with your Power Platform environment with an Azure AppID, tenantID and client secret.

inputs.name: Environment
inputs.label: Environment Url
inputs.helpMarkDown: Environment url this task targets; default is the pipeline variable that e.g. the CreateEnvironment task has set before.

inputs.name: ApplicationId
inputs.label: Application Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: Appplication Id to use to login.

inputs.name: RedirectUri
inputs.label: Redirect Uri
inputs.helpMarkDown: Redirect URI of the specificed App. Needed when specifying an App Id.
